trans-unit.source: How to manage Access Control Lists (ACLs) for Endpoints by using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: How to manage Access Control Lists (ACLs) for Endpoints by using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage ACLs with PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage ACLs with PowerShell

trans-unit.source: How to manage Access Control Lists (ACLs) for Endpoints by using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: How to manage Access Control Lists (ACLs) for Endpoints by using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: You can create and manage Network Access Control Lists (ACLs) for endpoints by using Azure PowerShell or in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can create and manage Network Access Control Lists (ACLs) for endpoints by using Azure PowerShell or in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In this topic, you'll find procedures for ACL common tasks that you can complete using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, you'll find procedures for ACL common tasks that you can complete using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For the list of Azure PowerShell cmdlets see <link><linkText>Azure Management Cmdlets</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For the list of Azure PowerShell cmdlets see <link><linkText>Azure Management Cmdlets</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about ACLs, see <link><linkText>What is a Network Access Control List (ACL)?</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about ACLs, see <link><linkText>What is a Network Access Control List (ACL)?</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to manage your ACLs by using the Management Portal, see <link><linkText>How to Set Up Endpoints to a Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you want to manage your ACLs by using the Management Portal, see <link><linkText>How to Set Up Endpoints to a Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Manage Network ACLs by using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Manage Network ACLs by using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: You can use Azure PowerShell cmdlets to create, remove, and configure (set) Network Access Control Lists (ACLs).
trans-unit.target: You can use Azure PowerShell cmdlets to create, remove, and configure (set) Network Access Control Lists (ACLs).

trans-unit.source: We've included a few examples of some of the ways you can configure an ACL using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: We've included a few examples of some of the ways you can configure an ACL using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: To retrieve a complete list of the ACL PowerShell cmdlets, you can use either of the following:
trans-unit.target: To retrieve a complete list of the ACL PowerShell cmdlets, you can use either of the following:

trans-unit.source: Create a Network ACL with rules that permit access from a remote subnet
trans-unit.target: Create a Network ACL with rules that permit access from a remote subnet

trans-unit.source: The example below illustrates a way to create a new ACL that contains rules.
trans-unit.target: The example below illustrates a way to create a new ACL that contains rules.

trans-unit.source: This ACL is then applied to a virtual machine endpoint.
trans-unit.target: This ACL is then applied to a virtual machine endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The ACL rules in the example below will allow access from a remote subnet.
trans-unit.target: The ACL rules in the example below will allow access from a remote subnet.

trans-unit.source: To create a new Network ACL with permit rules for a remote subnet, open an Azure PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: To create a new Network ACL with permit rules for a remote subnet, open an Azure PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the script below, configuring the script with your own values, and then run the script.
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the script below, configuring the script with your own values, and then run the script.

trans-unit.source: Create the new network ACL object.
trans-unit.target: Create the new network ACL object.

trans-unit.source: Set a rule that permits access from a remote subnet.
trans-unit.target: Set a rule that permits access from a remote subnet.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, you set rule 100 (which has priority over rule 200 and higher) to allow the remote subnet 10.0.0.0/8 access to the virtual machine endpoint.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, you set rule 100 (which has priority over rule 200 and higher) to allow the remote subnet 10.0.0.0/8 access to the virtual machine endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Replace the values with your own configuration requirements.
trans-unit.target: Replace the values with your own configuration requirements.

trans-unit.source: The name "SharePoint ACL config" should be replaced with the friendly name that you want to call this rule.
trans-unit.target: The name "SharePoint ACL config" should be replaced with the friendly name that you want to call this rule.

trans-unit.source: For additional rules, repeat the cmdlet, replacing the values with your own configuration requirements.
trans-unit.target: For additional rules, repeat the cmdlet, replacing the values with your own configuration requirements.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to change the rule number Order to reflect the order in which you want the rules to be applied.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to change the rule number Order to reflect the order in which you want the rules to be applied.

trans-unit.source: The lower rule number takes precedence over the higher number.
trans-unit.target: The lower rule number takes precedence over the higher number.

trans-unit.source: Next, you can either create a new endpoint (Add) or set the ACL for an existing endpoint (Set).
trans-unit.target: Next, you can either create a new endpoint (Add) or set the ACL for an existing endpoint (Set).

trans-unit.source: In this example, we will add a new virtual machine endpoint called "web" and update the virtual machine endpoint with the ACL settings.
trans-unit.target: In this example, we will add a new virtual machine endpoint called "web" and update the virtual machine endpoint with the ACL settings.

trans-unit.source: Next, combine the cmdlets and run the script.
trans-unit.target: Next, combine the cmdlets and run the script.

trans-unit.source: For this example, the combined cmdlets would look like this:
trans-unit.target: For this example, the combined cmdlets would look like this:

trans-unit.source: Remove a Network ACL rule that permits access from a remote subnet
trans-unit.target: Remove a Network ACL rule that permits access from a remote subnet

trans-unit.source: The example below illustrates a way to remove a network ACL rule.
trans-unit.target: The example below illustrates a way to remove a network ACL rule.

trans-unit.source: To remove a Network ACL rule with permit rules for a remote subnet, open an Azure PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: To remove a Network ACL rule with permit rules for a remote subnet, open an Azure PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the script below, configuring the script with your own values, and then run the script.
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the script below, configuring the script with your own values, and then run the script.

trans-unit.source: First step is to get the Network ACL object for the virtual machine endpoint.
trans-unit.target: First step is to get the Network ACL object for the virtual machine endpoint.

trans-unit.source: You'll then remove the ACL rule.
trans-unit.target: You'll then remove the ACL rule.

trans-unit.source: In this case, we are removing it by rule ID.
trans-unit.target: In this case, we are removing it by rule ID.

trans-unit.source: This will only remove the rule ID 0 from the ACL.
trans-unit.target: This will only remove the rule ID 0 from the ACL.

trans-unit.source: It does not remove the ACL object from the virtual machine endpoint.
trans-unit.target: It does not remove the ACL object from the virtual machine endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Next, you must apply the Network ACL object to the virtual machine endpoint and update the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Next, you must apply the Network ACL object to the virtual machine endpoint and update the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Remove a Network ACL from a virtual machine endpoint
trans-unit.target: Remove a Network ACL from a virtual machine endpoint

trans-unit.source: In certain scenarios, you might want to remove a Network ACL object from a virtual machine endpoint.
trans-unit.target: In certain scenarios, you might want to remove a Network ACL object from a virtual machine endpoint.

trans-unit.source: To do that, open an Azure PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: To do that, open an Azure PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the script below, configuring the script with your own values, and then run the script.
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the script below, configuring the script with your own values, and then run the script.
